channel.title: Personal on lostluck.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Personal on lostluck.dev

item.title: Burning Man Bike 2022
item.description:
I’m intending to go to Burning Man for a second time. One place where I underdid it, was getting the cheapest bike that fit. It was old. It was rusty. The best thing about it was its blue colour. It was a pain to move anything other than myself with it.

So this year, I’d like to try something different, if a bit spendier: a folding electric bike.

item.title: Shutternauting on JoCoCruise 2022
item.description:
Since 2013, I’ve been going on the JoCoCruise. It’s also where I was when the pandemic was officially declared in 2020.

I got to go back, for JoCoCruise 2022!

item.title: Journal 2020-10-12
item.description:
The following was written 7 months into the pandemic, at the listed published date. It was a dark time. I then proceeded to ignore this page until 2022-03-25.

Ah well.

item.title: WFH Desk
item.description: Since Quarantime began, I’ve been working from home, and my desk solution has steadily evolved throughout that duration.

item.title: Distractions in Quarantime
item.description:
This situation doesn’t feel real. Time isn’t passing as it normally does. As it should. It’s not really a quarantine.

It’s Quarantime.

item.title: About
item.description:
I’m Robert Burke.

I’m a Canadian, living in Seattle.

I am a software developer. I enjoy programming in Go. I’ve also used C++, Java, Javascript, Typescript, and Python, but I learned from the experience, so that’s nice. I currently do so at Google.

I’m a committer to Apache Beam, and work on its Go SDK.

I might be caught running. In pre-quarantimes, I’ve been known to do indoor rock climbing. I’ve also been known to sing a capella, as a bass. I enjoy playing Destiny 2, and Dungeons and Dragons, and watching content by Loading Ready Run and support the Desert Bus for Hope charity drive. I’ve been a repeat attendee of the JoCoCruise.
